Greetings,  Disclaimer: This message is intended for those who choose it, everyone has free will or the freedom to make their own decisions. We do not aspire this message to be prejudice or judgemental towards any who read it. We respect each and everyone's decision here today. If you decide that you are interested or have questions, feel free to message or reply. Feel free to skip over this message if you deicide to.   A message from the Gospel in The Christian Holy Bible. This is the message of forgiveness of sin through the sacrifice of Jesus Christ. In first Corinthians, chapter 15 verses 1 to 4, the apostle Paul states:  "Moreover brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I have preached unto you, by which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain. For I delivered unto you, first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures; and that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures".  Romans chapter 3 verse 23, informs us,   "For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord".   A sinner must recognise the despairing of her or his guilt before God in order for forgiveness to take effect.   Every believer must understand in order to inherit the kingdom of God as sons of the king, the reality of and foundational truth must be acknowledged, for all who approach the throne of God for salvation.   God promises us eternal life, for anybody who departs from sin through the saving faith in Jesus Christ.   Jesus lived a perfect and sinless life which no person could ever live. Jesus's sacrifice on the cross ultimately paid the debt we owe to God for our sin.   Sin against an infinite God requires an infinite sacrifice; and Jesus died a substitutionary death for the sinner.   In short, the works of Jesus paid the penalty of sin through an infinite sacrifice. Only the creator of life has the power to resurrect life after death and is essentially the proof of the power of God.   Jesus Christ offers his salvation as a free gift and may only be received by faith, despite any works or merit on our part.   The scripture in Romans inform us,   "If you declare with your mouth, Jesus is Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised him form the dead, you will be saved".   In conclusion, the resurrection of Christ is to bring everlasting life and salvation to anybody who follows him. The relationship between God and man can be restored through Jesus's saving faith.

You wonâ€™t take any fall damage when you land on the ground. -If you find a bastion, all you have to do is hit a piglin and all of the other piglins and brutes will come to you. Build up 2 blocks and hit them, or bow them from a distance. After they are all dead, you can loot the bastion easily. -If you are trying to find a blaze spawned in the nether fortress, follow these tips:      -If you see a staircase with netherwart, always go down it.      -If you see a staircase without netherwart, always go up it.      -If you see a balcony, always go to the hallway that is across it. If you go to the sideway hallways, you will find chests.      -If you see a room with one lava in it, then check the rooms connecting to it. If you see one of the rooms have a staircase, go the opposite way. There will be blaze spawners close to the other side.  -For hunting wither skeletons, try finding a fortress in a soul sand valley or a warped forest. Not a lot of mobs spawn in these biomes, so there will always be lots of mobs at the fortress. -Chances of finding ancient debris are boosted in basalt deltas, although basalt is harder to blow up than netherrack.  -Build you nether hub above the bedrock layer or in the ceiling of the nether to avoid mobs and bridging. Shulkercraft already made a video on how to get on the nether roof and how to break bedrocck.  -If possible, travel in the nether. 1 block in the nether is 8 blocks in the over world.  -You can spawn in different places based on the position you are standing while in the nether portal. A speed runner named Couriway used this method for spawning in a stronghold. He stood on the right side, which spawned him in the stronghold, and if he stood on the left side, he would have spawned above the stronghold.  -If you want to build a gold farm, the best method for getting magma blocks is looking around the nether for small patches of them near lava lakes. There will always be at least a stack of them below the patch on the surface.  -Quandrants are 4 parts of the nether around spawn that have structures in them. Each quadrant is about 400 blocks long and 400 blocks wide. There are 4 total quadrants, and you can use the x and z values to determine which one you are in. If the x is positive and the z is positive, you are in quadrant 1. If your x is positive and z is negative, you are in quadrant 2. If your x is negative and your z is positive you are in quadrant 3, and if both x and z are negative you are in quadrant 4. Only one structure can spawn in a quadrant, so if you find a bastion in positive x positive z, know that you have to change your direction to find a fortress. Couriway goes more in depth about quadrants in his nether tips and tricks video, be sure to check that out.   -Lastly, if you are fighting adult hoglins, tower up 3 blocks. Hit it 3 times with an axe (or 5 times with a sword) and before doing the last hit, use a flint and steel or a lava bucket to light it in on fire. You will get cooked food once you kill it. Also, baby hoglins donâ€™t drop anything, so just hit it once and they will run away from you. Also, if you donâ€™t want to deal with hoglins, just place a warped fungus and they will run from it.

In the middle of the night, Sherlock shakes Watson awake. "Tell me Watson" he said "What can you deduce by looking at the stars?"  Watson, slightly puzzled, said "Well,Â I can deduce by the number of them that the universe must be incredibly vast, and contain billions of stars. Likely, all of those stars have planets, and I could deduce that statistically, there must be at least one other planet capable of supporting intelligent life."  Seeing Sherlock shake his head, Watson continued.
